plugins.name: Snap Master 3000
plugins.description:
Do you ever dream to make widths in your design consistent, like a snap? 
Now your dreams come tue - Snap Master 3000 is already here!

Use predefined values for width snapping or use your own - now it easy and fast.

But that's not all!
Snap Master 3000 save your values after any snap for future use.

How to use Snap Master 3000?

⬇  1. Install plugin
⬇  2. Make sure your select something that can be resized
⬇  3. Click “Snap it!”
✔ Easy as never! 

Now all widths setted to nearest snap sizes, that you set in “Snap Master 3000”

If you want your avatars, icons and other objects can stays square after snapping - just check box!

plugins.name: MailerLite
plugins.description:
Skip the tedious work of exporting your images from Figma and then re-uploading them into MailerLite. Export your Figma assets directly to MailerLite’s File manager instead for even smoother campaign creation.


How this plugin works

  1. Select the layer you want to export.
  2. Run the MailerLite plugin.
  3. Choose or create a new folder for exporting your assets.
  4. Click ‘Export to MailerLite’ and locate your assets in the file manager.
  5. If a single file exceeds 2MB, it will be automatically compressed.


Visit MailerLite ->

plugins.name: Image Hotspot
plugins.description:
This plugin allows you to add hotspots to specific areas of your images, linking them to additional information, media content, or external links. It is a useful tool for interactive visuals in various applications such as educational materials, e-commerce sites, etc.


While the plugin is still in early alpha and development, it already provides essential functionality and is primarily intended as a useful development tool. It allows to export the data in JSON and CSS formats. The JSON format is intended for further processing in the application, while the CSS format is useful for quick hotspot positioning.


Instructions

  • Upload an image and frame the section you want to add a hotspot to
  • Enter a hotspot name and add it to the selected frame
  • Place the hotspot in the desired area
  • Export hotspot data and image


To convert frame nodes to hotspots, select "Convert" from the notification at the bottom of the screen when the frame is selected. Only a limited set of simple node types such as ellipse, rectangle, polygon, or other components (or instances of components) are transformed.


Feedback and suggestions for improving the plugin and meeting different needs are welcome.

accepted.name: Raimonds Sarkanbardis
accepted.description: Working hard to make the world better with software.

plugins.tagline: Create custom image hotspots and export position data effortlessly.

plugins.name: Расческа
plugins.description:
Плагин для UX-редакторов, которые подготавливают тексты для разработки. Выделите нужную зону и запустите плагин, чтобы:

  1. проставить неразрывные пробелы около коротких русских слов, чисел и специальных знаков;
  2. превратить отдельно стоящие дефисы (-) в тире (—);
  3. превратить дефисы внутри слов (-) в неразрывные дефисы (‑).


Все функции плагина. Если вам чего-то не хватает, заведите Issue (кнопка New issue) и опишите, что хотите.


Если вам очень помогает плагин, и вы в восторге от него, можете угостить меня кофе 😊
plugins.tagline: Подготовьте тексты перед разработкой: неразрывные пробелы и замена дефисов где надо

plugins.name: Pixcraft Email — Export HTML email code from your Figma design [Responsive, Outlook, Gmail, iOS]
plugins.description:
Documentation


Pixcraft Email instantly converts Figma designs into responsive HTML emails with just one click. The generated code is optimized for all major email service providers (ESPs) and clients, including Outlook. Built-in best practices enhance email deliverability, reduce spam risk, and ensure mobile-friendly, high-quality designs.


What if I do not have email designs ready?

Just use the auto layout and create any email design.

You can create any email design using auto-layouts for full flexibility.

Want to speed things up? Use our pre-built assets — over 100 ready-made headers, footers, content blocks, buttons, and interactive AMP components.

Need an even faster solution?

Check out our Figma community profile for a wide selection of free, professionally designed email templates!

You can also use email templates created with Marka, Cannoli, or Ampier.


How do you ensure the email code works across all email clients? Will it pass tests on Litmus or Email on Acid?


Yes! The autogenerated HTML email code follows best practices, using a table-based structure with <table>, <tr>, and <td> tags, along with inline CSS for maximum compatibility. It includes special conditional code to ensure proper rendering in email clients like Outlook. The code is optimized to pass tests on Litmus, Email on Acid, and other email preview tools, ensuring responsiveness and consistent display across all major email clients.


Pixcraft is optimized and tested for the most widely used email clients, covering 99% of email users based on your target audience. Supported clients include:

  1. Gmail (iOS, Android & Desktop Webmail)
  2. Apple Mail (MacOS & iOS)
  3. Outlook (Windows, MacOS, iOS, Android & Outlook.com Webmail)
  4. Yahoo Mail (iOS, Android & Webmail)
  5. Yandex Mail (iOS, Android & Webmail)
  6. Mail.ru (iOS, Android & Webmail)


This ensures optimal email rendering, responsiveness, and high deliverability across all major platforms.


Export

You can export the layout directly from the plugin to:

  1. Mailchimp
  2. Klaviyo
  3. SendGrid
  4. SendPulse
  5. Sendsay
  6. Unisender
  7. Altcraft
  8. and others.


Interactive AMP blocks

The plugin supports AMP and can export not only standard HTML but also AMP HTML. You can insert forms into emails, carousels, and other interactive elements.


Support and Suggestions

We always welcome feedback. If you encounter any issues or have ideas to share, please leave a comment or email us at team@pixcraft.io
plugins.tagline: Export responsive HTML email, that works even on Outlook

plugins.name: Flows Alicorp
plugins.description:
Español

¡Presentamos nuestro nuevo plugin de Figma diseñado por el equipo de Experience Design de Alicorp, perfecto para darle vida a tus diagramas y flujos de trabajo con flechas personalizables!


Con nuestro plugin, crear conexiones visuales entre tus ideas nunca ha sido tan fácil ni tan divertido. Elige entre líneas curvas, rectas o directas y personaliza cada detalle: desde el color y el grosor hasta la transparencia y el estilo de la línea, ya sea continua o punteada. ¿Necesitas flechas con un toque especial? Ajusta las cabezas de las flechas a tu gusto y añade cajas de texto que se integran perfectamente con el diseño de la línea.


Además, nuestro plugin te permite trabajar como más te convenga: puedes generar flechas automáticamente al seleccionar elementos, crearlas manualmente o modificar tus flechas existentes con un simple "Reiniciar". Todo está diseñado para que tu proceso de diseño sea lo más fluido posible.


¡Dale un vistazo y descubre cómo este plugin puede mejorar tu flujo de trabajo en Figma! ¡Te invitamos a probarlo y llevar tus diseños al siguiente nivel! 🚀


English

Introducing our new Figma plugin, crafted by the Experience Design team at Alicorp, perfect for bringing your diagrams and workflows to life with customizable arrows!


With our plugin, creating visual connections between your ideas has never been easier or more enjoyable. Choose from curved, straight, or direct lines and customize every detail: from color and thickness to transparency and line style, whether continuous or dashed. Need arrows with a unique touch? Adjust the arrowheads to your liking and add text boxes that seamlessly integrate with the line design.


Plus, our plugin adapts to your workflow: automatically generate arrows by selecting elements, create them manually, or modify your existing arrows with a simple "Reset." Everything is designed to make your design process as smooth as possible.


Give it a try and see how this plugin can elevate your Figma workflow! We invite you to test it out and take your designs to the next level! 🚀
plugins.tagline: Crea tus flujos

plugins.name: Magnifier
plugins.description:
Similar plugin: Draw a shape and create the pixelated censor effect


Features

  1. Zoom level from 1x to 5x
  2. Circle or rectangle shape
  3. Stroke color
  4. Corner radius


How to Use

  1. Draw/Place a rectangle over the area you want to magnify, then click "Apply"
  2. Adjust zoom levels, shapes, and other styles, then click "Update"
  3. Select "magnifier_group" at any time to make further updates


Use Cases

  1. Highlighting product features
  2. Explaining step-by-step processes in training materials
  3. Showcasing portfolios and marketing visuals


Pricing

  1. Enjoy 5 free uses with full access to all features.
  2. Unlock unlimited access with free future updates for a one-time purchase.


Tips

  1. After applying the magnifier effect, a group called "magnifier_group" is created. The group layer has a drop shadow effect, which you can adjust in the Design panel.
  2. Within the group, a "magnifier_shape" is created, that has a drop shadow effect for the white glowing effect inside the magnifier, and a stroke for the thickness of the magnifier, which you can adjust in the Design panel.
  3. Make sure the group and its children's names remain unchanged if you want to update it later.


Transform your designs with the magnifier effect, try it today!


Credit: Preview mobile screens by DI_Designing

plugins.name: Brainstorm
plugins.description:
The goal in Context: The UX Designer wants to create an efficient and effective copywriting process in Figma to improve the overall user experience of the product.

Main Flow:

The UX Designer launches Figma and selects a design project.

The Designer opens the Brainstorm Plugin

The Designer inputs the current text in the text element.

AI generates a list of copywriting suggestions based on the input.

The Designer selects the suggested copy that best fits the design and updates the text element in Figma.

The Designer continues to improve the copywriting of the design project by repeating steps 2-6.
plugins.tagline: Generate Content on the Go with AI

plugins.name: BrandIcon Generator
plugins.description:
BrandIcon Generator is a Figma plugin designed to simplify your branding process. Created by Fluidesigns, a branding and UI/UX agency, this tool reflects our understanding of efficient brand asset management.


Key Features:

* Export in PNG, JPG, and SVG formats

* Automatically generate sizes from 48x48 to 1024x1024

* Create social media-ready versions for Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and LinkedIn

* Generate favicons instantly

* Maintain proportional scaling and padding across all sizes

* Batch export all variations in one go


Perfect for designers, brand managers, and marketing teams, BrandIcon Generator saves hours of manual work and ensures consistency across all your brand assets. Whether you're working on a new brand identity or managing existing ones, this plugin streamlines your workflow, allowing you to focus on what matters most – creating impactful designs.


Developed with attention to detail and user experience, BrandIcon Generator reflects Fluidesigns' commitment to efficient and effective branding solutions.


For feedback or inquiries: enquiry@fluidesigns.in

plugins.name: Figma Helpers
plugins.description:
Figma Helpers is a set of automated actions that speed up and help manage your workflow.


Count and go to instances of a component

Find the number of instances for any component and traverse to each instance found on your current page.


Make working with text easier

Select a text layer and separate it into individual text layers or export all the text within a group or component.


Organize and manage your page layers

Sort layers by name or name and type as well as collapse to your top-level layer to navigate your file easier.


Update AutoLayout properties for all children at once

Update the Auto Layout properties of all immediate children to either Fill or Fixed / Hug. Works for both height and width properties.


Reach out to me on Twitter if you have feedback or want me to add new actions.

plugins.name: Figma Raw: Export Design Data for AI/LLM & Agents
plugins.description:
Bridge the gap between your Figma designs and the power of AI.

Japanese below / 日本語は後半に記載


Figma Raw exports detailed information about your selected Figma elements into clean, structured JSON, ready to be used with any AI/LLM tool or AI coding agent like Cursor or Devin.


🚀 NEW: Export Multiple JSON Files

Export your designs as downloadable JSON files! Select a single node for a .json file, or multiple nodes for a .zip archive. Now AI agents can process entire design systems and multiple screens in one go - a game-changer for AI-powered design-to-code workflows.


Why Figma Raw?

  1. Detailed & Accurate Export: Go beyond basic layers. Figma Raw extracts component names, properties, Auto Layout settings, and crucially, resolves the exact names of your Figma Variables (design tokens) and Text Styles.
  2. Seamless AI Integration: Copy the generated JSON (Pretty or Minified), export as files, or paste directly into your AI tool's prompt. Accelerate code generation, design analysis, documentation, and more.
  3. Design System Aware: Because Figma Raw includes the precise names from your design system (e.g., colors/primary/500, typography/body-large), you can instruct AI to generate code that perfectly aligns with your existing system, ensuring consistency.
  4. Generic & Future-Proof: This is a universal solution. Export once and use the JSON data across various LLMs and AI agents without being locked into a specific platform.
  5. Empower AI Agents: Provide AI agents like Cursor or Devin with the rich, structured design context they need to generate accurate, production-ready code directly from your Figma designs. With file export, agents can now process multiple designs automatically.


How it Works:

  1. Select the Figma nodes (frames, components, text, etc.) you want to export.
  2. Run the "Figma Raw" plugin.
  3. Copy the JSON data (Pretty or Minified) or click "Export JSON" to download files.
  4. Use the data with your AI/LLM tool or agent.


Ideal for:

  1. Frontend Developers leveraging AI for code generation at scale.
  2. Designers seeking accurate design handoffs to AI tools.
  3. Teams aiming to maintain design system consistency in AI-assisted workflows.
  4. Users of AI coding agents (Cursor, Devin, etc.) wanting to work directly from Figma designs.
  5. Anyone building AI-powered design-to-code pipelines.

This plugin is a private project by Tokyo-based designer Yasuhiro Yokota.


---


FigmaのデザインとAIの力を繋ぐ


Figma Rawは、選択したFigma要素に関する詳細情報を、クリーンで構造化されたJSONとしてエクスポートします。これは、あらゆるAI/LLMツールや、CursorやDevinのようなAIコーディングエージェントで使用する準備ができています。


🚀 新機能：複数JSONファイルのエクスポート

デザインをダウンロード可能なJSONファイルとしてエクスポートできます！単一のノードを選択すると.jsonファイルに、複数のノードを選択すると.zipアーカイブになります。これにより、AIエージェントはデザインシステム全体や複数のスクリーンを一度に処理できるようになり、AIを活用したデザインからコードへのワークフローにおいて画期的な変化をもたらします。


Figma Rawを選ぶ理由

  1. 詳細かつ正確なエクスポート: 基本的なレイヤーを超えて、Figma Rawはコンポーネント名、プロパティ、オートレイアウト設定、そして決定的に重要なFigma変数（デザインシステムトークン）とテキストスタイルの正確な名前を解決して抽出します。
  2. シームレスなAI統合: 生成されたJSON（整形済みまたはミニファイ済み）をコピーしたり、ファイルとしてエクスポートしたり、AIツールのプロンプトに直接貼り付けたりできます。コード生成、デザイン分析、ドキュメント作成などを加速させます。
  3. デザインシステム対応: Figma Rawはデザインシステムからの正確な名前（例: colors/primary/500, typography/body-large）を含んでいるため、AIに既存のシステムに完全に合致するコードを生成するよう指示でき、一貫性を確保します。
  4. 汎用的で将来性: これはユニバーサルなソリューションです。一度エクスポートすれば、特定のプラットフォームに縛られることなく、様々なLLMやAIエージェントでJSONデータを使用できます。
  5. AIエージェントを強化: CursorやDevinのようなAIエージェントに、Figmaのデザインから直接、正確で本番環境対応のコードを生成するために必要な豊富で構造化されたデザインコンテキストを提供します。ファイルエクスポートにより、エージェントは複数のデザインを自動的に処理できるようになりました。

仕組み:

  1. エクスポートしたいFigmaノード（フレーム、コンポーネント、テキストなど）を選択します。
  2. 「Figma Raw」プラグインを実行します。
  3. JSONデータ（整形済みまたはミニファイ済み）をコピーするか、「Export JSON」をクリックしてファイルをダウンロードします。
  4. そのデータをAI/LLMツールまたはエージェントで使用します。


こんな方に最適です:

  1. AIを活用して大規模なコード生成を行うフロントエンド開発者。
  2. AIツールへの正確なデザインハンドオフを求めるデザイナー。
  3. AIアシストワークフローでデザインシステムの一貫性を維持したいチーム。
  4. Figmaデザインから直接作業したいAIコーディングエージェント（Cursor, Devinなど）のユーザー。
  5. AIを活用したデザインからコードへのパイプラインを構築しているすべての人。


このプラグインは東京のデザイナー、Yasuhiro Yokota のプライベートプロジェクトです。

Enjoy vibe coding🎉
plugins.tagline: The Universal Figma-to-JSON Bridge for Any LLM & AI Tool.

plugins.name: MM Color Interpolation Grid
plugins.description:
Generate harmonious color palettes and explore smooth color transitions grids directly inside Figma.


Current version: 1.1.0


This plugin lets you create custom color interpolation grids using up to four corner colors. It’s perfect for designers exploring palette variations, easing models, or just geeking out on color theory.


Features:

  1. Choose top-left, top-right, bottom-left, and bottom-right colors.
  2. Generate harmonious starting color palettes with unique names in one click.
  3. Interpolate using multiple models: oklab, oklch, rgb, and more.
  4. Apply easing functions for smoother or creative transitions.
  5. Copy individual hex codes with one click.
  6. Insert the entire grid into your Figma file as named rectangles.
  7. Optionally create color styles for every cell, grouped by grid.


Great for:

  1. Building brand palettes
  2. Creating beautiful UI color scales/ramps
  3. Visualizing color transitions for design systems


A project by Alex Cristache & Mindful Motif.


A shout out to the creators of Culori and Color Name API for their invaluable resources.

accepted.name: Alex Cristache
accepted.description:

at MindfulMotif. Seasoned designer and digital strategist. Explorer of art & color through #MindfulPalettes on X.

plugins.name: HTML to Figma by html.tofig.design — Import Websites, Code & AI Content
plugins.description:
html.tofig.design: Transform Websites & HTML into Editable Figma Designs


Instantly convert any live website, HTML code, CSS, or even AI-generated code into fully editable Figma designs using html.tofig.design. Stop wasting time manually recreating web elements. Our powerful tool imports webpages and code directly into Figma with all layers, text, and styles preserved and ready for you to customize.


Accelerate Your Design Workflow


Why build from scratch? html.tofig.design lets you kickstart your design process by starting with existing websites or codebases. It's the perfect solution for:


  1. Redesigning existing websites without starting from zero.
  2. Creating benchmarks or moodboards in Figma using real website elements.
  3. Performing competitive analysis directly within your design environment.
  4. Prototyping and testing variations based on live web content.
  5. Quickly grabbing needed design assets from any website.


Key Features to Boost Your Productivity:


  1. Website to Figma Conversion: Convert entire live websites into editable Figma files.
  2. Direct HTML/CSS Code Import: Paste HTML or CSS code directly into our editor and turn it into design elements.
  3. AI-Generated Code Support: Seamlessly import designs generated by AI tools.
  4. Multi-Viewport Import: Capture desktop, tablet, and mobile views simultaneously.
  5. Editable Layers: All imported elements are organized, layered, and fully editable in Figma.
  6. Preserves Styles: Maintains typography, colors, spacing, and other CSS styles.
  7. Private & Login-Protected Site Conversion: Easily import secure websites using our browser extension.
  8. Local File Import: Convert local HTML files or ZIP archives.


How to Convert a Website to Figma with html.tofig.design:


Getting started is simple:


  1. Open the plugin menu in Figma and launch html.tofig.design.
  2. Enter the website URL you want to convert.
  3. Select the viewports (desktop, mobile, tablet) you need.
  4. Click "Import" and watch your website appear in Figma!


Convert Private Websites & Local Files:


Need to import a site behind a login or work with files on your computer? Download our Chrome extension for effortless conversion of private websites. You can also use the file import option for local HTML or .ZIP files.
plugins.tagline: Convert websites, HTML/CSS, and AI-generated code into fully editable Figma designs

plugins.name: Nester
plugins.description:
Nester will nest any object that resides above (but not inside) a top-level frame/artboard. 

If you have ever made a presentation or exported an asset only to find something you thought you put inside a frame, actually isn't, Nester will fix this automatically.

How to use:
Run Nester and it will detect if any object sits completely above another frame, and nest it inside. If the object overlaps the bounds of the frame and is not completely within a frame's bounds, it will leave the object as is.

plugins.name: Chaos Pattern
plugins.description:
Save time placing items in a grid pattern with random offsets, sizes and rotations, all of which can be fully customized.


How to Use

  1. Select one or more items, then click "Set" to use them as the pattern.
  2. Choose a frame or slide (Figma Slides) to apply the pattern.
  3. Click "Generate."
  4. Adjust the sliders to find the best settings.


Structure Settings

  1. Hexagon Grid: The horizontal position of every other row will be offset.
  2. Square Grid: Evenly spaced rows and columns.
  3. Circular Grid: Place items on a circular path.
  4. Spacing: distance between adjacent items.


Random Settings

Each slider represents how chaotic it is. 1 means very chaotic.

  1. Start Position: where the first item will start. 1 means random position of [-spacing, spacing] will be added.
  2. Rotation: how far each item can randomly rotate. 0.25 means between -45º and 45º, while 1 allows full rotation between -180º to 180º.
  3. Grid Offset: how far from their original grid position the items can randomly spawn. 0 means the items are locked to the grid.
  4. Transparency: the level of opacity to apply. 0 means no change. 0.25 means applying a random opacity between 0.75 and 1.
  5. Scale: how much scale factor should be randomly applied. 0.5 means the scale will be randomly chosen between 0.5x to 1x.


Pricing

  1. 5 free uses with full access to all features.
  2. Unlock unlimited access and future updates for a one-time purchase.


Tips

When you generate items multiple times on the same frame, the plugin recognizes which items it created and will automatically remove them for you. If you'd prefer to keep previously generated items, consider grouping them before generating new ones.


Credits

  1. Preview Bubble screen by Татьяна Крупина
  2. Preview Animal screen by dini.matu
  3. Preview Tree screen by The Visual Team
plugins.tagline: Place items on a grid with random offsets, sizes and rotations!

121518.name: Chaos Pattern
121518.description:

How to Use

  1. Select one or more items, then click "Set" to use them as the pattern.
  2. Choose a frame or slide (Figma Slides) to apply the pattern.
  3. Click "Generate."
  4. Adjust the sliders to find the best settings.


Structure Settings

  1. Hexagon Grid: The horizontal position of every other row will be offset.
  2. Square Grid: Evenly spaced rows and columns.
  3. Circular Grid: Place items on a circular path.
  4. Spacing: distance between adjacent items.


Random Settings

Each slider represents how chaotic it is. 1 means very chaotic.

  1. Start Position: where the first item will start. 1 means random position of [-spacing, spacing] will be added.
  2. Rotation: how far each item can randomly rotate. 0.25 means between -45º and 45º, while 1 allows full rotation between -180º to 180º.
  3. Grid Offset: how far from their original grid position the items can randomly spawn. 0 means the items are locked to the grid.
  4. Transparency: the level of opacity to apply. 0 means no change. 0.25 means applying a random opacity between 0.75 and 1.
  5. Scale: how much scale factor should be randomly applied. 0.5 means the scale will be randomly chosen between 0.5x to 1x.


Pricing

  1. 5 free uses with full access to all features.
  2. Unlock unlimited access and future updates for a one-time purchase.


Tips

When you generate items multiple times on the same frame, the plugin recognizes which items it created and will automatically remove them for you. If you'd prefer to keep previously generated items, consider grouping them before generating new ones.


Credits

  1. Preview Bubble screen by Татьяна Крупина
  2. Preview Animal screen by dini.matu
  3. Preview Tree screen by The Visual Team

121518.tagline: Place items on a grid with random offsets, sizes and rotations!

plugins.name: Delete Any Layer
plugins.description:
Say goodbye to tedious deletion tasks and hello to efficiency with Delete Any Layer, a powerful Figma plugin designed to streamline your workflow.


This plugin empowers you to effortlessly delete all items (including hidden and locked) within a selected region. Simply follow these steps:


  1. Select the target region: Define the area where you want to delete items. This could be a freehand selection or an already existing frame or group.
  2. Type the item name: Enter the name of the element you want to remove.
  3. Witness the magic: Select Type Delete instantly identifies and removes all matching items within the chosen region.


Benefits:

  1. Unmatched precision: Say goodbye to accidental deletions! The plugin only removes items with the exact name you specify.
  2. Effortless batch deletion: No more manually selecting and deleting items one by one. This plugin handles it all with ease.
  3. Enhanced efficiency: Save valuable time and effort, allowing you to tackle projects faster than ever before.
plugins.tagline: Delete visible, hidden and locked layers with a click!

plugins.name: Figma to Jitera Studio (Beta)
plugins.description:
Convert Figma designs to Jitera Studio with love.


How does it work

1) Install the plugin

2) In Figma hit cmd+/ and search "Figma to Jitera Studio" and hit enter

3) Select a layer you want to export


Limitations

Exporting designs to code are a best-effort process. Even getting 90% there can save you a ton of time, only having to clean up a few things.


If you find any issues or have feedback at all please contact us.
plugins.tagline: Import Figma designs into Jitera Studio.
